intro: Pectinaria mammillaris, commonly known as the mammillary pectinaria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate to flourish. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
